sentences.en: A miasma of stale alcohol hung around him.
sentences.cn: 他身上老有股难闻的酒精味。

sentences.en: Because if you don't have any fresh ideas, then you use stale tactics to scare the voters.
sentences.cn: 因为，如果没有任何新鲜的想法，你就用一些陈腐的战术去恐吓选民。

sentences.en: By using stale metaphors, similes, and idioms, you save much mental effort, at the cost of leaving your meaning vague, not only for your reader but for yourself.
sentences.cn: 使用陈腐的暗喻、明喻和习语，你省了不少思考的力气，代价是你的意义的模糊，不仅对读者，也对你自己模糊。

sentences.en: French bread goes stale (= becomes stale ) very quickly.
sentences.cn: 法式面包极易变味。

sentences.en: He was aware of the stink of stale beer on his breath.
sentences.cn: 他知道自己嘴里有股变味啤酒的馊味。

sentences.en: I believe in progression, in taking risks, in never getting stale.
sentences.cn: 我崇尚进取、冒险和永不倦怠。

sentences.en: I gagged on the stench of stale urine.
sentences.cn: 尿臊味让我想吐.

sentences.en: I tucked some plastic wrap around the sandwiches to keep them from getting stale.
sentences.cn: 我用塑料包装纸把三明治裹起来，防止变质。

sentences.en: Running water is never stale and a door - hinge never gets worm - eaten.
sentences.cn: 流水不腐,户枢不蠹.

sentences.en: Running water never gets stale.
sentences.cn: 流水不腐.

sentences.en: stale cake
sentences.cn: 不新鲜的蛋糕

sentences.en: stale jokes
sentences.cn: 老掉牙的笑话

sentences.en: The air of the room was fetid with stale tobacco smoke.
sentences.cn: 房间里的空气有陈烟的臭味.

sentences.en: The bread is too stale to eat.
sentences.cn: 面包太陈不能吃了.

sentences.en: The phony glamour of night clubs soon became stale and boring.
sentences.cn: 夜总会那种虚荣的繁华不久便失去了新意而使人生厌.

sentences.en: The room smelled musty and stale.
sentences.cn: 这个房间闻起来有股发霉的陈味儿.

sentences.en: Their marriage had gone stale .
sentences.cn: 他们的婚姻已了无热情。

sentences.en: There was a powerful smell of stale beer.
sentences.cn: 有一种呛人的过期啤酒味。

sentences.en: They bait the mousetrap with stale cheese.
sentences.cn: 他们用变质的乳酪作捕鼠夹的诱饵.

sentences.en: Your breath reeks of stale cigar smoke.
sentences.cn: 你满嘴都是难闻的雪茄味。

trans.tran_en: bread or cake that is stale is no longer fresh or good to eat
something that is stale has been said or done too many times before and is no longer interesting or exciting
